actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to improve the functioning of Federal agencies by providing for initiation of rulemaking based on requests made to such agencies.
short_title: Federal Rule Making Improvement Act of 1979

summary.text: Federal Rule Making Improvement Act of 1979 - Permits any person to request a Federal agency to initiate a rulemaking proceeding. Requires the agency to: (1) grant or deny such request within 120 days; and (2) initiate such a proceeding within 30 days after granting such request. Authorizes the requesting person to petition a United States court of appeals to order the agency to initiate such a proceeding if the agency denies or fails to act on such request. Specifies the conditions under which a court shall issue such an order.

titles.title: Federal Rule Making Improvement Act of 1979
A bill to improve the functioning of Federal agencies by providing for initiation of rulemaking based on requests made to such agencies.
